targets.query:
from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "disk_serial" or r["_field"] == "disk_model" or r["_field"] == "disk_status")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Current_Pending_Sector")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
|> last()
  |> limit(n: 1)
 |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
 |> group(columns: ["_time"], mode:"by")
 |> map(
    fn: (r) => ({
        r with
            //////////////////////////
            //Disk_Status value mapping
            //////////////////////////
            disk_status_converted: if r.disk_status == 1 then
                "Passed"
            else if r.disk_status == 2 then
                "Failed"    
            else
                "ERROR!!!!",
        }),
    )
  |> drop(columns: ["_measurement", "_stop", "_start", "_time", "nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute","disk_status"])
  |> rename(columns: {disk_model: "Model", disk_serial: "Serial", disk_status_converted: "Status"})
  |> yield()

panels.description:
RAW value: This value is expressed as a percentage of the average erase count and the rated erase
count of the media, which is the percentage of lifetime used as opposed to the Current
Value which is the percentage of lifetime remaining.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Percent_Lifetime_Remain")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
   |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with sata1_percent_life_remain: (100.0 - r.RAW_value)}))
    |> drop(columns: ["_measurement","nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute", "_field", "_start", "_stop", "RAW_value"])
    |> rename(columns: {sata1_percent_life_remain: "SATA1 Percent Life Remaining"})
  |> yield()

Reallocated_Sector_Ct=from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")

  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> drop(columns: ["_measurement","nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute", "_start", "_stop"])


Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot=from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
    |> drop(columns: ["_measurement","nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute", "_start", "_stop"])

join(tables: {Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot: Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot, Reallocated_Sector_Ct: Reallocated_Sector_Ct}, on: ["_time","_field"])
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with sata1_percent_life_remain: ((r._value_Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot / (r._value_Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot + r._value_Reallocated_Sector_Ct))*100.0)}))
   |> drop(columns: ["_field_Reallocated_Sector_Ct","_field_Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot","_value_Reallocated_Sector_Ct","_value_Unused_Rsvd_Blk_Cnt_Tot", "_field"])

//Micron ECO 5200 1.92TB SSD is rated for 3.5PB of write endurance @ 512-bit sectors
//SSD data sheet found here: https://www.micron.com/solutions/technical-briefs/micron-5200-series-of-sata-ssds

from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Total_LBAs_Written")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
   |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with sata1_percent_life_remain: 100.0-(((r.RAW_value*512.0)/3500000000000000.0)*100.0)}))

    |> rename(columns: {sata1_percent_life_remain: "SATA1 Write Endurance Remaining"})
  |> yield()

panels.description: Endurance (TBW in PB) for Micron 5200 ECO is 3.5 Peta-Bytes

targets.query:
//Micron ECO 5200 1.92TB SSD is rated for 3.5PB of write endurance @ 512-bit sectors
//SSD data sheet found here: https://www.micron.com/solutions/technical-briefs/micron-5200-series-of-sata-ssds

from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Total_LBAs_Written")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
   |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with sata1_percent_life_remain: (r.RAW_value*512.0)}))
    |> drop(columns: ["_measurement","nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute", "_field", "_start", "_stop", "RAW_value"])
    |> rename(columns: {sata1_percent_life_remain: "SATA1"})
  |> yield()

panels.title: Bytes Written

panels.description:
Write amplification factor (WAF) is a numerical value that represents the amount of data a solid state storage controller has to write in relation to the amount of data that the hosts flash controller has to write.  The numerical value is calculated as a rate by dividing the amount of data written to flash media by the amount of data written by the host.

A write amplification factor of 1 means that 1GB of data was written to the flash host media and the hosts flash controller also wrote 1GB.  A write factor of 1 is ideal, but occurs less frequently as the media gets used and the number of program/erase (P/E) cycles increases.  Program/erase cycles are managed by the device's flash controller, which uses a logical to physical mapping system known as logical block addressing (LBA) to manage data. When data is rewritten, the flash controller writes the new data in a different location and then updates the LBA with the new location. Invalid data continues to reside in the old location and those cells must be erased before they can be written to again. Because each cell can only tolerate a finite number of program/erase cycles before becoming unreliable, the higher the write amplification factor, the closer the media is to end-of-life.

targets.query:
Host_Program_Page_Count=from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Host_Program_Page_Count")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> drop(columns: ["_measurement","nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute", "_start", "_stop"])


Bckgnd_Program_Page_Cnt=from(bucket: "Test/autogen")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "Bckgnd_Program_Page_Cnt")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
    |> drop(columns: ["_measurement","nas_name", "disk_path", "smart_attribute", "_start", "_stop"])

join(tables: {Bckgnd_Program_Page_Cnt: Bckgnd_Program_Page_Cnt, Host_Program_Page_Count: Host_Program_Page_Count}, on: ["_time","_field"])
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with sata1_percent_life_remain: ((r._value_Host_Program_Page_Count + r._value_Bckgnd_Program_Page_Cnt)/r._value_Host_Program_Page_Count)}))

panels.title: Write Amplification Factor

panels.description:
Average erase count of all good blocks. 
also known as "FTL Program Page Count" Number of NAND pages written by the FTL.

This value stores the cumulative FTL program page count. This attribute tracks the
number of NAND pages programed by the FTL which are in addition to operations programed by the host. Write amplification factor can be calculated by WAF = (Attrib_247 +
Attrib_248) / Attrib_247.

WAF = (Host Program Page Count + FTL Program Page Count) / Host Program Page Count

what was previously negotiated (6 Gb/s).

  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "synology_SMART_status2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["nas_name"] == "Server-Plex")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["disk_path"] == "/dev/sata1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "RAW_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["smart_attribute"] == "SATA_Int_Downshift_Ct")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> drop(columns: ["_field","_measurement","nas_name","disk_path","smart_attribute","_start","_stop"])
   |> rename(columns: {_value: "SATA1"})
  |> yield()
